author: Special Correspondent
text:
Keeping alive the speculation over his contesting the coming Assembly elections, Trinamool Congress leader Madan Mitra said here on Friday that a final decision on his candidature would be taken by party chairman Mamata Banerjee.

“Once she [Mamata Banerjee] directs me, I will start work [campaigning],” Mr. Mitra told journalists while being produced before a court.

Arrested in connection with the Saradha chit fund scam, Mr. Mitra said he had learnt that party MP Saugata Roy had raised the issue of his candidature. “I thank him for that. But until and unless there is an official decision, I will not say much,” he said.

There’s speculation that the Saradha scam accused will contest from Kamarhati seat
title: Mamata will decide if I should contest polls: Madan Mitra
